bioghist.p: Roberto Morgadanes did graduate work on Mexican drama at the University of Pennsylvania. His advisors were Joseph E. Gillet, and, following Gillet's death, Otis H. Green.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of Mexican dramatic material assembled by Roberto Morgadanes during field work in Mexico for his graduate studies. in which he researched the origins of drama in colonial Mexico. Materials include: manuscript and typescript dramatic manuscripts, 1868-1934 (some of the transcripts appear to be of older pieces -- dating to the 16th century); and correspondence (1940-1942) between Morgadanes and members of the University of Pennsylvania's Department of Romance Languages (mostly Otis H. Green) about Morgadanes' enrollment in the department and the progress of his studies.
